Posts.Content: This is my department!! I am the ultimate "rester"! Not to be confused with lazy or being a sloth! A women needs her beauty rest and needs to learn how to get more of it as there is not enough down time at night!! We women must pratice the fine art of delegating duties and fine tuning our bodies. By gosh, just look at all those beautiful painted pictures of women from centuries ago. How well rested do they look? Laid back on those Roman loungers, adored and being waited on!! First of all, find your comfort spot. This is claimed by you and will be available 24/7 and must be relinquished by other users at your whim! Second, find your comfort food. This must always be stocked and readily available for you. Third, find your comfort pleasure. This may be a favorite show or movie to watch, music to listen to, scenery to view, a relaxing bath, a massage or closing the curtains and crawling into bed (sleep not neccessarily the goal!). Last, we must learn to ask to be waited on! This may be accomplished by using the following phrases....."My goodness, I am exhausted and need nurishment. Honey, would you bring me a bowl of ice-creeam?"..."These treatments have taken the wind right out of my sail. Honey, would you mind massaging my aching muscles for me?"..."I wish I could just relax from all this stress. Honey, would you fix me a warm bath to soak in?"..."Gesh, my body is tired but my mind is racing. Honey, would you bring me my book I was reading?" (you get my point!). We women must take charge and put our beauty rest at the top of the list!! Our bodies are precious and we must pamper them any chance we get!! We must choose to snooze!! Fellow women....unite!! Ummmm.....that means you too Moopy!! :(-) Pammy

Posts.Title: Tomorrow's the "Day" (10--21-09)

Posts.Content: I'm sorry to hear about your situation. I don't know if this will help but another option (I know someone who did this) is to go to several attorneys for a free consultation (most are free for the first visit) and be sure to ask a different specific question with each one. This helps you to gain knowlege and see where you stand. Also, depending which state you live in, some states are an equal distribution state and a family law master makes a final decision based on the law rather than arguement. The state I live in is like that. Check to see if your state is (ask a lawyer at a consultation). Also, this is a bully tactic your husband's lawyer is performing. If it is a judge or law master that decides, they need to stay reasonable in the end. Unforunately, you will need to retain a lawyer to help you through the legal process. Who knows, if you talk to enough of them, one may take your case for free. Good luck in your situation. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: metastatic breast cancer and SURVIVING AN ABUSIVE EX-HUSHAND

Posts.Content: OK, everyone. I have a change of plans this weekend. My hubby decided to surprise me with a week long get-away to Connecticut (we haven't done anything all year)!! He wants to leave here tonight at midnight when he is done working. I love to be spontaneous, but he forgot how tired I get from Rads still. I haven't even started packing yet (yikes!). Something I can usually pull off in an hour has taken me all day! I mostly made a list, gathered a few essentials and fell asleep. I just woke up and realized I have to get moving. OMG...I took a 5 hour nap! My first nap in 4 months....go figure. Just wanted you to be aware that I would be gone, so no one would worry. I will still probably check in as I will not be able to keep up with them, plus I see myself taking many breaks still. Can't over do it. We are staying with friends of ours (he is a scientist with Brystol-Myers Squibb). He works with Altheimer drugs, but is going to introduce me to a scientist that is working with BC drugs for his field. I am fastinated to hear what will be out there in the future. These are very fasinating men and I just love hearing about the latest breakthroughs. They are usually very serious people, and I have a blast making them laugh. Most of the time, what they are talking about goes "swoosh" right over my head. So I just nod and keep ordering Martinis until, all the sudden, I "get it". This somehow makes them laugh? They always ask our friend when we will be visiting each year, to make plans to get together with us. So the new "BC" drug guy hasn't met me yet! Now picture this....they are taking a country girl out to places that charge $12.00 a drink (gulp!...thats a whole case of beer!) and 4 little half shells, of clam casino, for $18.00. So what happens is, I start ohhh'ing and ahhh'ing at EVERYTHING, and they find this fascinating and fun! They are use to looking at cells and molds all day under a microscope, that it is fascinating to them to watch me enjoy the different cultures with such awe. And it seems that every place we go to always has huge fish tanks, that by the fourth Martini, I am usually talking to the pretty fishy by making funny fishy faces with them. They just usually order me one of those fancy smancy coffe drinks for a change of pace. But guess what....now I'm a WIDE AWAKE drunk!! (And the coffee always has Baileys in it....duh!) Didn't think we were going, but hubby made surprise arrangements. Plus our friends brother, Luigi Cantone, who has done many paintings for alot of famous people, is working on a painting for me!! Yeah! He is hoping to complete it by the time we leave. I have always wanted one of his paintings, but they are thousands of dollars and I can only afford $19.99 walmart specials!! So I am extremely excited to see what he is working on. Well, I better get moving and start packing. I will keep you all in my prayers and think about you often. Many cyber hugs and smiles..... â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Change on weekend plans!!

Posts.Title: OK LAST ONES FOR AWHILE I PROMISE!

Posts.Title: I'm off..

Posts.Content: I recieved my card today!! I will save the envelope too. My first card of the season! I have it on my mantel and I have read it five times already for a much needed pick me up! Thank you dear, you truly are the ultimate "kindred spirit"!!!! Hugs and smiles...â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Chen~You Cheated!!

Posts.Content: Taleena, now I absolutely beleive in angels!! What a wonderful unselfish act on your part to set aside all that is on YOUR plate and go above & beyond to help Bill out. I would be proud to be a character witness for you in your fight to keep your neice (if you needed one). And it was a big deal to look up the information even if you were off.....I myself am proud to have such a caring friend! :) Pammy
Posts.Title: *****Bill**** This is for you*****B12

Posts.Content: Here I am on vacation and I can't stay away from the boards. Geesh...I guess that makes me a true addict. I was only going to read some, while I took a break, and came across this thread. It wasn't my plan to respond...just read. (By the way, your all having a blast in Connecticut!! Teehee). I think those of you that have gone before me are looked up to with the utmost respect. Your wisdom, kindness, patience in answering our questions over and over again, insight, quidance, and direction onto the right path is sought after and found in you. So many of us value what you have to say. So many of us feel lost until we read a response from you that allows us to breath once again. I couldn't imagine what it would be like if we did not have you all on these boards. I am truly blessed that you are there for me and everyone else. Just your presence gives me a sense of comfort and security in getting through what will probably prove to be the biggest challenge in my life. Thanks for sticking around, while you live life after cancer, to help all us see that someday we too will get to live life after cancer. Thanks for being there for us. Ok, I'm done getting mushy....good thing I can blame these sniffles on the Tamoxifen!! Hugs and smiles..... â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: FOR ZAHALENE! You made my day!

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry that you are going through this right now. Not much that I can add to say that hasn't already been expressed (these women are soooo smart!) except I will be your friend. I fell apart this morning when my washing machine broke! All I could think of was what would go next. Then I quickly decided anything could break as long as it wasn't me!! Hang in there, and vent anytime you need to. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Pity Party

Posts.Content: I'm pretty sure they were trying to hide the fact from you that they think your a cutie and that is why they keep calling you back. So don't let them know that you know or we know that they don't know that you know...you know?? I think you will have the results by Wednesday. I had mine within 48 hours. That is something that is read that day and the stained ones the next day. Hang in there and know that you are getting closer even if it is at a snails pace. :(-) Pammy
Posts.Title: Not wasting any time that

Posts.Content: Keeping you both in my prayers. â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: prayers for my daughter

Posts.Content: I didn't realize how much comfort you recieve just knowing everyone is there with you!! (sniff, sniff) I just love everyone here and can't tell you how much it has helped me to get through all this just to come here and do my thing (be myself!). I don't have to fake it face to face with anyone saying I am just fine because I don't want to cry in front of you & bring you down (just my nature). Here, I can be moody if I feel like it or blue or upbeat or down or even sideways (that would be a great pic to show!). It feels so good to be yourself no matter where your emotions are at the time. So, again I thank everyone for hanging in there with me and really want you to know.....I REALLY HAVE THE WILLYS GOING ON HERE!! I'M ALL BUGGED OUT, WIDE AWAKE, HEART BETTING 10 MILES A MINUTE, AND I SWEAR I HAVE ACCUMULATED 500 MORE GRAY HAIRS!!! Whew...Now that I got that off my chest....I think it is time for me to go get ready for that really HOT dude that will be drapping me with the really warm blanket all over my naked body!!......darn, and I'll be sound asleep!! Will catch up with everyone later today! (blowing kisses as she skips towards the awaiting bubble bath!) Ta ta........:) Pammy
Posts.Title: For Pammy

Posts.Content: OMG, I just had a terrible thought! I just read your post 3x's and realized what you said! What if they missed some cancer I don't know about? Like I haven't had anything done since the surgery to "look" to see if they got it all that I know of. I mean they were looking at one particular spot, but what if they missed something? They drained a cyst to do my biopsy because it was in the way, but that was after my Breast MRI, so it may be possible that there was something the cyst was covering up! OK, maybe I shouldn't have had that extra cup of coffee after dinner tonight! :(-) Pammy
Posts.Title: Not wasting any time that

Posts.Content: First of all, welcome. Second of all, this is pretty normal so I have already expected it to happen when I go for my first check up. And even though you have the knowledge this still may not help your fears. Hang in there....I think if they truely were concerned, you would have recieved a phone call to come back right away instead of a standard (basically form letter) sent to you 2 weeks later. Make sure you keep us informed!! :) Pammy
Posts.Title: I'm scared

Posts.Content: That was the COOLEST thing I have done so far since I was Dx'd with BC!!! What an awesome memory!! It was such a pleasure to meet all of you....Greta, Jeanne, Phoenix, Tasha, Claudia, Patty, Marcia, and Margo!!! Everytime I read post now.....your voices are in my head and it makes the words on the page come alive! Wouldn't it be great if the ACS & CSN had a way of holding a reunion for us???? So we could all meet over a weekend together??? That would be the only thing that I could think of to top the conference call. I am so blessed that I was able to participate. I hesitated, I stared at the clock, thought of other things I should be doing, I almost walked away from the phone....in the end, I picked it up and dialed. So glad I did!!! :) Pammy
Posts.Title: It Was A Great Conference Call Today! :)

Posts.Content: Since I was home sick today, I finally found a few extra minutes to stop by and say hello and tell you how much I missed you all!! I am nearing my 2nd Cancerversary in a few weeks and of course alot of memories surround this thankful occasion. Life does have a way of slowly creeping back to some form of normalacy and it seems that time starts to go TOO quickly!! What can I say to update you? Well, I recently had a scare last month and underwent lymph node biopsy, but I am happy to announce that they were negative (in my clavical area). Yea....(clapping hands!) Yesterday, however, I became extremely painful in my joints and have had a butterfly rash on my face for several weeks. Doc ran boocoo blood work (along with some specialized test) and I am currently awaiting the results. I did get some relief though, after 2 shots in each butt cheek and 4 scripts from the pharmacy. (Geesh, I'm trying to ditch pills, not add more!) His suspicions? A childhood disease called Parvovirus or Lupus. Parvovirus is spreading among the children alot around here, but the few adults that he has seen contact it are having extreme symptoms. Once you have it (just like chicken pox) you become immune to it. Wish cancer could be that way! I haven't even begun to think about the possibility of Lupus. I'll wait on the test results first. I am still working on accepting the fatigue that will never go away, the weight gain that I can't lose, the dry skin, the hot flashes, the night sweats, the lack of energy, the ridged nails, and the fact that trying NOT to eat ice-cream on any diet is just plain torture to myself. Therefore, I will embrace the ice-cream diet without guilt! In case you were wondering what the ice-cream diet was....every diet I am on will INCLUDE ice-cream! (giggling...) I have not been here in so long that I hope all of you are hanging in there the best you can. I would love to hear how you have been doing. Having Cancer sucks, but when you think about it, we really have no choice but to accept it and embrace it. Do the best we can, which is not always easy. The hardest thing for me was to get back my ability to giggle. As positive as I stayed, I was sad when I realized that having cancer was robbing me of my one pleasure in life....laughter. But I regained 99% of that back and I will keep that as a victory over this ugly disease! Hope and hugs to everyone, â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Stopping by....

Posts.Content: Well...Arimedex is out and Femara is in (on July 1st). I have a 30 day break in between. My problem is that I have been having flank pain on my left side in my back that has not gone away. Thought the Arimedex may have been responsible, but I guess not. I'm worried. They did find some blood in my urine. But so far, that's it. I am sorta on a hold because our new Insurance starts on the first and requires authorizations. Can't get in for too many test before that. So need to wait till the first to get things set up. My question....has anyone experienced this type of pain? Dull, achy, and constant. I even have a sense of 'fullness' like something is waiting to 'pop' deep inside me. Any thoughts? Sigh....always seems like I am either heading for a storm, in a storm, or just coming out of one! Hugs and hope, â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Flank pain....

Posts.Content: Well, tried to switch Kitty Kat's picture for mine but it won't let me, any advice? I noticed a couple new pics and thought I would change mine. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Pic of me......

Posts.Content: Hi everybody. Just came back from Rads and I am bumming out. Hubby and I had a spat over the hail damage and Insurance Company sending their person whom also does the repairs in the area. That's fine except I intend to get several estimates. I have never heard of this company and also I have the added expense of having several other layers of shingles removed before new can be put down. How do I know that I am getting the best price? I think that he is feeling sooooo stressed (me too) that we are having a difficult time talking about problems that would otherwise be handled differently. I felt bad because after he snapped at me (which is so rare) I refused to look at him. He would not let me get out of the car until I gave him a kiss and let him apologize. I still didn't say a word. I went in. I know my tech could tell I was not my usual self. When I was done this time she said the nurse needed to see me. I was all prepared with a speech thinking my tech was just concerned with my mood. Whew....all the nurse wanted to do was check my skin. Which she says is looking pretty good. It's just a tad pink and stings a little, off and on, but nothing really happening yet. As for my hubby, he apologized several times. He's forgiven but I still feel like crap. Darn, what a crappy day this turned out to be. Guess you'll have those now and then, huh? :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Day 6 of Pammy's Rads

Posts.Content: â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Getting Married

Posts.Content: ....making assumptions and going by "national averages" so to speak is definitly mistreatment by your current Doctor. If she did not have the results on that pathology report, she should have called for a final path report prior to mapping out your treatment. (I personally would run from someone like this!!!) Sometimes this test is done as part two and is an addition to the initial report. It may be listed seperately. If it was not done, then insist on it. All laboratories keep a sample on a slide of your speciman for future testing (or to send to other labs for genetic testing. etc). If you have no choice but to stay with this Oncologist, then I certainly would stand up and start making demands. Take someone with you if you have to. This is your life and it is not eligable for any guessing games!!! Good luck and please let us know what you find out!! :) Pammy
Posts.Title: meeting with onocologist

Posts.Content: You posted my exact concerns and suggestions!! Although, rather than just one of us bringing up these ideas, I think they would consider it more if they were hearing the same suggestions over & over from all of us. So lets all keep sugesting the things that we all want. For those of us that will be on this friday and those calling in on the 29th (that is the one I will be at). :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Conference Call Questions - Do you have some ready?

Posts.Content: Of course I am praying for you. I had 7 benign lumpectomies before my eighth one was malignant. Maybe you are doing the opposite! You had your malignant one, so anymore will turn out to be benign! Keep us posted. â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Definitely NOT Dancing With Ned

Posts.Content: Saw my PCP to get my flu shot today and have my check up and go over all my treatments. Got the regular flu shot, but will NOT get the H1N1 when it comes out. We talked about it and have decided in my case against it. But I urge everyone, if your Doc ok's it, to get your flu shots now. Doc said going around early and quickly and unless you have A-1 immune system, you will most likely catch it. Yikes!! In all total in the past 4 months, I have gained 14 pounds!! No more ice-cream for me! (boohoo) He told me not to worry about it. But I do!! OMG...my hubby feel asleep! My Doc and I talked for hours! The office was closed and locked up when we left! He is so thrilled that I am so up to date on all the stuff out there, when it comes to this disease. We spent 45 minutes on the internet alone, just looking up what drugs I could have while on Tamoxifen. He was going to put me on a script to help me sleep when I asked "is it compatible with the Tamoxifen?". He said "lets look it up"....was shocked when he discovered so many drugs were not available for me. Said it was a great thing I brought it to his attention as he did not know. He also advised me to be careful what drugs I take as Tamoxifen can mess up your cholesterol and so can some other drugs. You don't ever want to take meds that do this at the same time. He knows I run everything past my Medical Onc before taking anyway. He does look out for me though. Said he researched and helped his Mom get past BC around 2003 and he is amazed how much has changed. Gotta love him though, he was unrelenting and found something for me to try. It is a muscle relaxant called "Zanaflex". I'll take it at bedtime and see if this doesn't do the trick. Oooohhh....and then we had the BIG talk about lack of libido. Wanted to know if I thought it was from Tamoxifen or more a mental/emotional issue? I thought not from the Tamoxifen, as I have had so much done to me, that I haven't even thought about sex! He said "don't worry, since YOU can't take the antidepressant, we'll put your hubby on them, and then he won't care your not having sex!". Nothing like leaving his office laughing hysterically!! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Got my Flu Shot today, did you get yours?

Posts.Content: Gracie, hope all went well for you today. Post and let us know when you get a chance! â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: Barium nightcap

Posts.Content: Don't even think about it!! This is just Gods way of teaching us patience (which I think we are not getting it, so he keeps trying!). I am having the lagging too alot lately. I keep thinking that maybe I need to dump some files on my computer, but son says not the problem....site is the problem. So, who would like to be secretary and write down our concerns that will be at the conference call? We only have an hour and you know how fast that will go by!! Someone should start a list!! Volunteer? Anyone? :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Anyone Else Having Trouble On The Site?

Posts.Content: Ok, guess I'll just have to keep the one in my head! Are you sure if I google you on "you tube" nothing will come up? Congrats on your last day! I hope you are still wearing your beads and doing your happy dance! Ummm....could you dance just a tad more to the left of the doorway (that's where I hid the camera!)? Wow, now I wonder what my center does, if anything. Let's see, we do not have ANY popcorn. My last three visits there was a huge candy jar on the ledge. So today I decided I wanted a couple pieces of tootie rolls (yes, I checked the jar out first day I saw it and knew everything inside) but it was gone! Maybe they caught me scoping it out! Also, in 3 weeks time, I have not heard any bells ringing or yeeha's or any sound eminating from the hallways. Wow, I hope they do SOMETHING or I will feel really left out!! Then it will cost hubby a fortune to make me feel better. :(-) Pammy
Posts.Title: Thank you from Teena ... last day of RADS!

Posts.Content: Thanks for the laugh! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Back at the Ranch...

Posts.Content: Children are amazing...my daughter had her hair cut (18 inches!!) and donated it to "Locks for Love" the day I was given the news just to show her support and to let me know she was there for me. (Sniff...sniff) I cried because I hadn't given any thought as to how much my children really loved me till that day.

Posts.Title: Ya Gotta Be "carefuL'---what you tell the Grand Kids----these days...!!!!

Posts.Content: I absolutely love Claudia's idea (think I will steel this one) and going with an all pink theme. How much fun at the end of the night would it be to give each guess a "pink" baby pin to pop all the balloons? You could even have a piece of paper in each one written with a short note on something someone did that really was a blessing to you. They would have fun popping the balloons and reading the thank you notes inside aloud!! (:-) Pammy
Posts.Title: Time to Celebrate

Posts.Content: From one mom to another.....take extra tissues!!!! Your little boy just took his first big steps towards becoming a man some day! Awwww.....keep a good ear open on the first girl he mentions in his class....that will be his first school crush!! Good luck at your Doctor appointment this week. We will always be here for you whenever you need to stop by (they won't trust us with a space scooter yet to run around cyber space!) so you know where to find us!! Remember, lots of tissues (and know that he'll be in good hands!). :O) Pammy
Posts.Title: Thank you all...

Posts.Content: Traci, I was just about to tell you that the Udderly Smooth was developed for cows Udder's when I read the last post! LOL They make a hand cream I really like too. I couldn't use any of the lotions as they made me itch (no known allergies) so I used 100% Pure Aloe only. But when I was first using the lotions I would slather it on after my shower in the morning, after Rads in the afternoon, and at bedtime. The Udderly Smooth does absorb better than the Aquaphor. Good luck with the experimenting. You do know that by the time you get it just right, rads will be over!! Hugs and smiles...â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Overachieving Rad Girl -- would appreciate advice from Rad Graduates!

Posts.Content: Way to go Patty!! If I get a letter like that, I don't care how corney it sounds, I'm going to frame it and put it where I can look at it everyday!! I'm so happy for you! You deserve to go celebrate....so scat...get going...have a good time! :(-) Pammy

Posts.Title: Good Luck

Posts.Content: What blessings to hear yet another year to celebrate!! We are just as blessed to have you among us. You give much hope to alot of us that are following in your footsteps. We are proud to call you "friend"!! :(-) Pammy
Posts.Title: To perhaps relieve some ambivalence...

Posts.Content: NED spelled backwards is DEN (Definitely Exciting News!!)? Congrats!! â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: Dancing with NED

Posts.Content: I was just going to post a new discussion to ask if anyone is getting nausous on the Tamoxifen and you just confirmed my suspiscions. I am having the same problem and some favorite foods, for whatever reason, are starting to have a funny taste to me. I was afraid that maybe the large dose of calcium and vitamin D may have been the culprit, but they didn't bother me prior to taking the Tamoxifen. But sometimes it takes a while to work on your system. My body is trying everything to reject this drug, but I really want to give it a chance. As a result, I am losing a few pounds (which is ok) but at the same time, need to keep my healing going with proper nutrition. Here's what really blew my mind....I am having a difficult time drinking water too! Haven't found anything I feel like drinking. If you make something like chrystle Light, since it's made with water, does that count as drinking water? Anyone know? Hope our nausea's get better! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Tomoxifen and weight gain

Posts.Content: Just wanted to wish you luck on your 2nd round. Hope it is easier than the first for you. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: 2nd chemo treatment, wish me luck

Posts.Content: got comfy, had snacks (we all shared!), and chatted away. Will definitly look for the next one. 0:) Pammy

Posts.Title: Great 6 monthl check-up

Posts.Content: Thanks, Susan, for letting us know we were being missed on the boards! Steeeeeeefffff....(she runs with open arms as she giggles!)!!!!! You gave me such a fuzzy warm feeling by missing me! I miss everyone too!! I really, really need a few more hours in the day to do all the things I want to!! Which would include posting here daily. I think my life after cancer has gotten busier than prior! I am back to work full time!! We are very, very busy and I, too, am addicted to FB. (Sigh)...It at least creates a harmless escape! I invite everyone to try it! Then you can be my neighbor!! (nooooooo....I am NOT cheating by inviting hundreds of people at one time!). Tuesday I go for my first mammo and check up with all my Docs in Pittsburgh. I am staying positive on the results. Alright, you caught me! I am shaking in my boots (that would be if I was actually wearing boots, I would be shaking in them!). I am having PT done on my arm starting next week. Absolutely LOVE the Ortho Doc!! Even though he used a 10 foot needle into my joint! OK, that wasn't true....it was only 8 foot!! I am struggling with the fatique (post treatment) and struggling with trying to lose the 15lb weight gain from the past year. There has to be a way to diet WITHOUT giving up ice-cream!! I hope everyone is hanging in there! Hubby is starring at me b/c we were getting ready to run to the store when I said, "wait! There is something I have to do or I will forget." Here I am 15 minutes later still typing away!! I am sending all of you gigantic cyber hugs!! Take care and I will try to pop in more than once a month!! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: Dear T...I'm Tuseday. Could you be Monday? Maybe we are having them done on the same day? ROFLOL.....didn't matter who was ahead or behind the whole time because, in the end, we ended up in the same place! High five!! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: Mine was pretty much the same as Traci's with the exception that my Doc allowed me to take a xanax the morning of, which really helped. Also, my lumpectomy was done under general anesthisa. I think they do all they can to keep you pain free. â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: question about a lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I just had a chance to get on the computer late tonight, so I am very late in responding. I was wondering though if you are feeling better? Anxiety is a terrible feeling to have to deal with. I found that xanax works well for me when it becomes more than I can cope with. Seems to mellow me right out within 15-20 minutes. If you have nothing to take, talk to your Doctor and ask if he can presribe you something for just these moments. I really hate to make it sound like all our problems can be fixed from a pill bottle, but under these circumstances, why go through anything more than we have to? Please post and let us know how you are. (:-) Pammy
Posts.Title: So scared, alone and need to RELAX....HELP

Posts.Content: (jumping up and down with hand in the air!) Will you please include me on the card? I miss Tasha too! Thanks Claudia for offering to send her a card! Hugs and smiles...â™¥Pammy

Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: There is no doubt in my mind that I will be here as long as the boards exist. I am a giver and enjoy helping others. I love to tell about my experiences in hopes that someone walks away enlightened from them. Besides, I have no friends on the outside (I work with ALL men!) and so (lucky all of you!) I have attached myself here! Besides, if I wasn't here, I would just be in my own little world all the time. But it's OK, they know me there! (LOL). â™¥ Pammy

Posts.Content: Dear T...I'm Tuseday. Could you be Monday? Maybe we are having them done on the same day? ROFLOL.....didn't matter who was ahead or behind the whole time because, in the end, we ended up in the same place! High five!! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: I miss you guys

Posts.Content: You sound alot like me....many cyst, 7 previous lumpectomies. Finally sent for Breast MRI. The area I was originally sent for was not even of concern once I got to Cancer Center for MRI (I would have ended up with another lumpectomy as opposed to a needle biopsy again). The MRI showed a completely different story & turned out to be accurate (confirmed by core needle biopsy). So here I am finally getting a needle biopsy first & needing the lumpectomy anyway!! But had they done needle biopsies on me the last 7 times, I would have been spared a whole lot more since they were always benign....go figure?
Posts.Title: Biopsy on Friday

Posts.Content: Before January, huh? Well, why not just call up and let them know you would like to make the appointment for December 31st!! May as well get that part of it out of the way!! LOL :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Dr Charisma-Bypass....

Posts.Content: Yes, the fear is playing havoc not only on your mind, but your body as well. It is very draining. I find comfort knowing nothing stays the same and these feelings will too pass. Hang in there, deep breaths and know you are stonger than you think and will pull through! â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: I feel very old today...but I'm not really old

Posts.Content: I want one! If you find you accidently purhased two, Vicki, give me a yell! â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: I feel very old today...but I'm not really old

Posts.Content: Another keeper....thanks. â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: First Christmas Joke of the Season

Posts.Content: Looks like you are now out of the starting gate and on the track!! So happy for you! how wonderful about your new GYN. That has to be a bright spot in all this. I'll give you a trick that helped me when I tried to quit.... The next cigarette you want, just tell yourself that you will have it in 5 minutes. Then wait. Then in 5 minutes, tell yourself you will wait just 5 more minutes. Then wait again. Eventually, you find yourself going longer than 5 minutes without realizing it and in no time the craving actually goes away temporarily. Be strong (which I absolutely know you are!) and tell yourself you will do this. Lots of hugs.... â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: First Day of Rads Today for T...

Posts.Content: ....that could be there for her! You probably made her feel safe and loved. Congrats on the 'Aunt' status and what a great Aunt you will be!! Hugs....â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: The Miracle of Life.... I just had to share...

Posts.Content: It stinks, doesn't it? But hang in there and like you said....just keep moving forward!! Thats a big accomplishment, 3 chemos!! :(-) Pammy
Posts.Title: 3 RD Treatment Tomorrow

Posts.Content: That's a first for me. Usually the tornaments around here have a brand new car sitting on the toughest hole (almost impossible to get). It's more for advertising. I think in all of the history of the course, it was obtained 1 time. Whenever hubby plays in tornaments, I'm always excited to see what he won!! Glad you were able to go and have fun and for a good cause!! â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: Teeing it up for Ta Ta's Golf Tournament

Posts.Content: I have been where you are (was talking about it a few days ago). Anti-depressants make me more depressed, so they are no longer an option. Sometimes it is just a matter of finding the right one. I will keep you in my prayers and hope that you are feeling better soon. Your the most important thing right now to take care of, so we will wait patiently for your return! Hugs and smiles...â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: phoenixrising--AKA Jan--where are you?

Posts.Content: Wanted to extend my welcome to both of you and to wish you good luck in your treatments. We are here to walk through it with you, so come back anytime and for any reason. â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: For all who have received a scarf or headwrap from Laurie....

Posts.Content: Glad you found us, though sorry for the reason. I think Claudia summed up alot for me. I can tell you that in my experience, waiting for EVERYTHING is the hardest part. For someone like me that is a VERY patient person, the waiting kills me in this instance. Hang in there. Come here often. And keep us posted. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: New to this

Posts.Content: Wanted to say Hi and welcome you to the boards. Glad you have decided to introduce yourself. We look forward to talking with you too. â™¥ Pammy

Posts.Content: Maybe that is why I had what I had in my mind!! Thanks for the explanation. â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: RECONSTUCTION RE IS HAVING HOPEFULLY ONE FINAL SURGERY

Posts.Content: Smart women!!! Ah ha!! I'm learning EVERYONES tricks!! You've heard of the all important little black book? Well, I keep an all important little pink book!! Don't worry...I keep all the tricks & tips anonymous in case it is ever discovered and I am busted by hubby!! :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Doing Well

Posts.Content: Didn't realize so much was involved to get a nipple! This is what went through my head about reconstructing a nipple the simple way.....they took suctures and did a basting stitch in a circle where they wanted the nipple to be, both ways, then pulled tight together to pucker it, and let it heal like that! Of course, everything in my head is simple!! â™¥ Pammy
Posts.Title: RECONSTUCTION RE IS HAVING HOPEFULLY ONE FINAL SURGERY

Posts.Content: Good point about the friends list. If I add you and you don't add me......well then I'm just going to go saulk in the corner because I feel rejected.... But then if I just add "everybody" I will have the biggest friends list on the board and....click, click, click (hope I get to everyone!!) â™¥ Pammy

Posts.Content: So glad to hear that you are doing well peggy. Keep up the good work! â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: peggys day 19

Posts.Content: you were married and your spouse ruined your credit, but when you devorced you were also stuck with the history? Now you need a job, but you suffer because your spouse screwed up? I hope it is not legal to run a check on your credit. But if it is, maybe consider asking in the interview what type of checks they will be doing. Then if they mention a credit check, consider explaining your circumstances and assure them it will not interfer with your job. By being upfront, they may put it aside and appreciate your honesty. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Job Interview Questions

Posts.Content: Grilled guppies!!! Soak squewers in water over nite,,,alternate guppies,seaweed,cherry tomatoe,,,,season with old bay,salt & pepper,,,,,grill on BBQ turning once till done!!! Beware.....this recipe comes from the one who DOES NOT cook (me) and better half who is the main cook (Hubby) suggest serving over saffron rice!! (says sprig of parsley is optional). :)
Posts.Title: Need recipe for lobster and clams

Posts.Content: Glad you did! It's tough to catch up, isn't it? Don't apologize though, this sorta stuff happens. :) Pammy
Posts.Title: Soy and Vitamin D

Posts.Content: Thanks for th laugh!! :) Pammy
Posts.Title: 4th of July joke

Posts.Content: Wow, another week gone already! Only two weeks left after today! Sigh, these salads I have been suffering through better have paid off this past week!! My son and I have decided to start a walking routine Wednesday. That should give me a boost towards my final goal! As soon as I get all the results in, I will post. Hmmmm....it seems to me we had a challange to beat the person in front of us. Wonder how we all did! Good luck everyone! â™¥ Pammy

Posts.Content: ....and sending lots of hugs! â™¥ Pammy

Posts.Title: ((( CLAUDIA )))) AKA ((( CHENHEART))) Just following up..

Posts.Content: Best wishes for tomorrow! Hope it is the lesser of the two possibilities. My prayers are with you. I just know that you will get through this with the same strength that got you through BC!! Keep us posted when you get the chance. Hugs and smiles. â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Prayers and Good Thoughts for your Surgery Tomorrow, Judy

Posts.Content: I am about 1 1/2 years out and I am very tender! The way my Radiation Oncologist explained it to me was that the radiation will actually 'shrink wrap' your tissue inside. So that everytime you move or poke the area, it 'pulls' on the tissue and causes pain. It only takes the slightest touch to 'move' the tissue that doesn't want to 'give'. To me, it's like having PMS in that boobie ALL the time...ache, ache, ache! So now I am in the process of learning to live with it in case it never goes away (which is a possibility). It can be an unfortunate long term side effect of radiation. Hope yours gets better with time... â™¥Pammy
Posts.Title: Breast still tender 1yr later after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Just down the hall, through the doors to the left, around the corner and towards the back was the cubicle that the nurse escorted Bill and Pammy to. Crisp white sheets covered the bed. Two leather chairs for sitting were off to the side. Crash cart and medical equipment scattered about the room reminded you that you were still in a hospital. If it wasn't for the obvious, she could have pretended she was somewhere else; anywhere else. The nurse was giving her instructions. "Take everything off except your underwear. Put the first gown on so that it ties in the back. Put the second gown on, like a robe, so that it ties in the front. These are for your feet. This is to put over your hair; but we'll worry about that later. When your all done, open the curtain and I will be back for your clothes. Any questions?" Pammy thought to herself that she had a million and one questions but none that required an immediate answer. So she simply said, "No". The nurse left and she turned to Bill. "Well, if I had known I was going to be leaving my underwear on, I would have worn a fancier pair!!" He responded with "If it would make you feel better maybe I could run out and find you something different....how about something in hot pink?" This made her laugh. He helped her change and then pulled the step stool out from under the table so she could take her place on the bed. Then he opened the curtain and sat down in one of the chairs to wait. Pammy was much better at waiting then he was. He began to tap his fingers on the arm of the chair. It wasn't long before the nurse came back. With her she brought an elderly gentleman & a wheelchair. "Looks like you are scheduled for a guided needle and sentinal node injection all the way on the other side of the hospital. So if you just have a seat, we'll be happy to take you for a ride. Once we get this out of the way, we'll bring you back here for your surgery? Do you need to use the bathroom?" Pammy thought to herself, bathroom? I have willing starved and deprived myself of all liquids so I can let someone I barely know cut me up and you want to know if I need to use the bathroom? Not unless I want to stick my head in the toilet, she thought. I'm dehydrated!! She quietly answered, "No". "Well then, your off. Bill, you can go with her. We will see the two of you back in about an hour". And away we went, the same way we came in. Down the hall, around the corner, to the right, past the waiting room...... Bill and the elderly gentleman made small talk as Bill held open doors, pressed elevator buttons, and moved obstacles out of the way. It was a 15 minute walk to radiology and Pammy was hoping it would be more like 15 miles. She was not looking forward to this part of her ordeal. With every exit door they passed, she thought about leaping out of the chair and taking off. But instead she sat silent and let them wheel her to the other side. She closed her eyes and silently said over & over again..."Please, Lord, do not let this hurt!" After repeating this thru the last set of doors, she opened her eyes and there he was!! Stay tuned for chapter 3.......
Posts.Title: Chapter 2....
